description.text: This option defines the action to be taken.

choice.choiceText: Creates the MLD querier router on the Ixia interface. Requires the use of -handle.
Modifies the MLD querier router on the Ixia interface. Requires the use of -handle.
Deletes the MLD querier router on the Ixia interface. Requires the use of -handle.
The MLD querier router will be disabled. Requires the use of -handle.
Enables the MLD querier router on the Ixia interface. Requires the use of -handle.

description.text: If -mode is create, delete, modify, enable or disable this option is required to specify the existing MLD Querier session.
MLD Querier Version
The number of general query messages sent at startup.
General Query Interval in seconds
If true (1), enable IP Router Alert Option.

Defines the subnet vulnerability to lost packets. MLD can recover from robustness variable minus 1 lost MLD packets. The robustness variable should be set to a value of 2 or greater (7 being the maximum).
General Query Response Interval in milliseconds

The maximum amount of time in seconds that the MLD Querier waits to receivea response to a Specific Query message. The default query response interval is 1000 milliseconds and must be less than the query interval. This parameter will be set (-mode create and -modify) only if discard_learned_info is not enabled.

Indicates the total number of specific Query messages sent every Specific Query Response Interval seconds before assuming that there is no interestedlistener for the particular group/source. This parameter will be set (-mode create and -modify) only if discard_learned_info is not enabled.
Indicates whether or not the Querier participates in querier election. If disabled, then all incoming query messages are discarded.
Indicates whether the Querier will comply to RFC 3376 Section 7.3.2 and RFC 3810 Section 8.3.2. If disabled, all membership reports with a version less than the current version are discarded.
Indicates whether the Querier downgrades to the lowest version of received query messages. If disabled, all query messages with a version less than the current version are discarded.

When -discard_learnt_info is 0, the emulated Querier maintains a complete record state for received reports and send queries (based on timer expiry for received groups and sources). If -discard_learnt_info is 1, the Querier does not maintain any database and only sends periodic general queries. The specific query group/source record information is not calculated based on any earlier received report, but is based only on the last received report.
Specifies if the selected querier will be active or not.
Name of the sppecified stack.
Defines the number of sessions to create on the interface.
IP address of the test interface / emulated MLD Querier.
The IP address step between each session.
The netmask length value for the interface.
IP address of the neighbor.
The IP address step between each session.
The MAC address for the interface to be created.
The incrementing step for the MAC address of the interface to be created. Valid only when using IxNetwork Tcl API.

Enables vlan on the directly connected MLD router interface. Valid options are: 0 - disable, 1 - enable. This option is valid only when -mode is create or -mode is modify and -handle is an MLD router handle. This option is available only when IxNetwork tcl API is used.
VLAN ID for emulated router node. Valid for mode create and modify.
For multiple neighbor configuration, configures the VLAN ID mode to fixed or increment. Valid for mode create and modify.

When -vlan_id_mode is set to increment, this defines the step for every VLAN. Valid for mode create. When vlan_id_step causes the vlan_id value to exceed it's maximum value the increment will be done modulo <number of possible vlan ids>. Examples: vlan_id = 4094; vlan_id_step = 2 -> new vlan_id value = 0 vlan_id = 4095; vlan_id_step = 11 -> new vlan_id value = 10
VLAN user priority assigned to emulated router node. Valid for mode create and modfiy.
Enable/Disable Rate Control
No. of Queries (per Time Period)
Time Period

returnValue.value: A list containing the mld querier protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ethernet protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ipv6 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv6 client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
The handles for the MLD Querier created Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

notes.note: 1) MLD implementation using IxTclNetwork is NOT SUPPORTED in HLTAPI 3.30. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: mld_querier_handles, interface_handle

code_examples.example: # Command :- ixiangpf::emulation_mld_querier_config # This command will cretae MLD Querier my $mld_querier_1_status = ixiangpf::emulation_mld_querier_config ({ mode => "create", handle => "<ipv6_handle>", version => "version2", startup_query_count => "2", general_query_interval => "125", router_alert => "true", robustness_variable => "2", general_query_response_interval => "10000", specific_query_response_interval => "1000", specific_query_transmission_count => "2", support_election => "true", support_older_version_host => "true", support_older_version_querier => "true", discard_learnt_info => "true", active => "true", name => "{MLD Querier", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: #This example will modify a MLD Querier my $igmp_querier_modified = ixiangpf::emulation_mld_querier_config ({ mode => "modify", handle => "<mld_querier_handle>", active => "0", }); # The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1}
